lowrank.pruners package¶

Pruner Base Class Implementation and other useful package wide code

class lowrank.pruners.AbstractPrunerBase(model: tensorflow.python.keras.engine.sequential.Sequential, scope: lowrank.pruners.PruningScope, sparsity: float, data: Optional[tuple[numpy.ndarray, numpy.ndarray]] = None, batch_size: int = 64, loss: Optional[tensorflow.python.keras.losses.Loss] = None)[source]¶

Bases: object

Pruners take a model, and upon examining its effective weights, computes rank masks for each layer

compute_scores() → list[list[int | float]][source]¶

Computes and returns scores for the singular vectors in each layer. - High Score = Important Singular Vector - Low Score = Unimportant Singular Vector

create_masks()[source]¶

Create masks for the pruning method. Calls compute scores which is implemented by the subclass overriding the base Pruner class.

prune()[source]¶

Calls the compute_mask method and actually sets the ranks

set_mask_on_layer(layer: lowrank.low_rank_layer.LowRankLayer, mask)[source]¶
set_rank_capacity_on_layer(layer: lowrank.low_rank_layer.LowRankLayer, capacity: Optional[int] = None)[source]¶
class lowrank.pruners.PruningScope(value)[source]¶

Bases: enum.Enum

Pruning Scope determines how to use scores to rank singular vectors and generate mask. Global ranks globally, Local ranks locally

GLOBAL = 1¶
LOCAL = 2¶
lowrank.pruners.create_mask(length: int, indices: list[int], inverted: bool = False)[source]¶

Helper function that creates mask given

Submodules¶

lowrank.pruners.alignment_pruner module¶

Alignment Pruner (Defined in overleaf)

class lowrank.pruners.alignment_pruner.AlignmentPruner(model: tensorflow.python.keras.engine.sequential.Sequential, scope: lowrank.pruners.PruningScope, sparsity: float, data: Optional[tuple[numpy.ndarray, numpy.ndarray]] = None, batch_size: int = 64, loss: Optional[tensorflow.python.keras.losses.Loss] = None)[source]¶

Bases: lowrank.pruners.AbstractPrunerBase

Alignment pruners scores singular vectors based on how much each singular vector perturbs the model output from the baseline

compute_scores() → list[list[int | float]][source]¶

Score = Magnitude of the vector difference between output of model when passed all 1s (with singular vector zeroed out and not) Intuition = the singular vectors that change the output vector the most from baseline activation are the most important

lowrank.pruners.gradient_snip_pruner module¶

Gradient SNIP SV Pruner - implements actual SNIP gradient method for SV

class lowrank.pruners.gradient_snip_pruner.SnipPruner(model: tensorflow.python.keras.engine.sequential.Sequential, scope: lowrank.pruners.PruningScope, sparsity: float, data: Optional[tuple[numpy.ndarray, numpy.ndarray]] = None, batch_size: int = 64, loss: Optional[tensorflow.python.keras.losses.Loss] = None)[source]¶

Bases: lowrank.pruners.AbstractPrunerBase

Class for Gradient SNIP Pruner Implements compute score to score singular vectors using Gradient SNIP Method.

compute_scores() → list[list[int | float]][source]¶

Score = -1 * gradient of c_j - a continuous relaxation of the binary switch for a singular value evaluated at c_j = 1 for all j in weights Intuition = if

lowrank.pruners.mag_pruner module¶

Magnitude Pruner

class lowrank.pruners.mag_pruner.MagPruner(model: tensorflow.python.keras.engine.sequential.Sequential, scope: lowrank.pruners.PruningScope, sparsity: float, data: Optional[tuple[numpy.ndarray, numpy.ndarray]] = None, batch_size: int = 64, loss: Optional[tensorflow.python.keras.losses.Loss] = None)[source]¶

Bases: lowrank.pruners.AbstractPrunerBase

Magnitude pruners scores singular vectors based on magnitude of the vector

compute_scores() → list[Union[numpy.ndarray, Iterable, list[int], list[float]]][source]¶

Computes and returns scores for the singular vectors in each layer. - High Score = Important Singular Vector - Low Score = Unimportant Singular Vector

lowrank.pruners.snip_pruner module¶

SNIP SV Pruner - calculates Delta L instead of gradient estimate

class lowrank.pruners.snip_pruner.SnipPruner(model: tensorflow.python.keras.engine.sequential.Sequential, scope: lowrank.pruners.PruningScope, sparsity: float, data: Optional[tuple[numpy.ndarray, numpy.ndarray]] = None, batch_size: int = 64, loss: Optional[tensorflow.python.keras.losses.Loss] = None)[source]¶

Bases: lowrank.pruners.AbstractPrunerBase

Class for SNIP Pruner Implements compute score to score singular vectors using SNIP Method.

compute_scores() → list[list[int | float]][source]¶

Score = loss if masking out the singular vector Intuition = if loss when masking out the singular vector is high, then the singular vector must be important.
